outline.title: 2024-2030 Research Report on Typical O&M Strategies and Intelligent Transformation of Power Transmission, Transformation, and Distribution

chapters.title: Chapter 1: Macro-Strategic Context and Evolution of the 'New Power System'

Electrification trends: Load characteristics evolution and peak-valley widening

sections.title: 1.2 The Imperative of Digital Transformation
subsections: From 'Periodic Maintenance' to 'Condition-Based Maintenance' (CBM)
Data as a core asset: The shift from business-driven to data-driven O&M

OPEX breakdown: Maintenance costs vs. emergency repair expenditures

chapters.title: Chapter 3: Intelligent O&M Technical Architecture and Platform Design

sections.title: 3.1 Ubiquitous Sensing and IoT Layer
subsections: Advanced sensor deployment: MEMS, fiber optic sensing, and passive wireless
Edge computing nodes: Localized data processing and protocol conversion
Communication network optimization: 5G slicing and LPWAN applications

sections.title: 3.2 Cloud-Edge Collaboration and Data Middle Platform
subsections: Construction of the Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT) platform
Data lake architecture for massive time-series and unstructured data

sections.title: 3.3 Artificial Intelligence and Algorithm Engines
subsections: Computer Vision (CV) for defect recognition in transmission/distribution
Predictive maintenance algorithms based on machine learning
Optimization solvers for maintenance scheduling and resource allocation

chapters.title: Chapter 4: Transmission Network O&M: Visualization and Three-Dimensional Defense

sections.title: 4.1 UAV and Autonomous Inspection Systems
subsections: LiDAR scanning and 3D point cloud modeling of transmission corridors
AI-driven autonomous flight planning and defect identification
Fixed-wing vs. multi-rotor drone collaborative operation strategies

sections.title: 4.2 Dynamic Line Rating and Channel Monitoring
subsections: Real-time dynamic capacity expansion based on environmental sensing
Anti-external force damage monitoring: Video surveillance and AI alerts
Disaster prevention: Wildfire, icing, and galloping monitoring systems

sections.title: 4.3 Live Working and Robotics
subsections: High-voltage live working robots and teleoperation technologies
Insulator cleaning and coating robots
Safety protection and electromagnetic field monitoring for personnel

chapters.title: Chapter 5: Transformation (Substation) O&M: The Smart Substation Ecosystem

sections.title: 5.1 Primary Equipment Online Monitoring
subsections: Transformer Dissolved Gas Analysis (DGA) and partial discharge monitoring
GIS/HGIS gas density and mechanical characteristic monitoring
Infrared thermography and acoustic fingerprint analysis

sections.title: 5.2 Intelligent Inspection and Operation
subsections: Wheeled and rail-mounted inspection robots: Navigation and recognition
One-key sequential control systems for switching operations
Digital twin visualization of substation status and simulation

sections.title: 5.3 Secondary System and Protection O&M
subsections: Remote operation and maintenance of relay protection devices
Cyber-physical security monitoring for substation automation systems
Loop status inspection and virtual terminal visualization

chapters.title: Chapter 6: Distribution Network O&M: Reliability and Active Management

sections.title: 6.1 Transparent Distribution Grid Perception
subsections: Smart distribution transformer terminals (TTU) and low-voltage visibility
High-precision fault location: Traveling wave and impedance methods
Topology identification and phase checking technologies

sections.title: 6.2 Self-Healing and Distribution Automation
subsections: Centralized vs. distributed feeder automation (FA) strategies
Fast fault isolation and service restoration algorithms
Single-phase earth fault handling and arc suppression

sections.title: 6.3 Active Distribution Network (ADN) and DER Integration
subsections: Voltage regulation and reactive power optimization with high PV penetration
Grid-edge interaction: V2G and demand response coordination
Microgrid islanding and seamless transition control

chapters.title: Chapter 7: Lean Management System and Organizational Transformation

sections.title: 7.1 Condition-Based Maintenance (CBM) Strategy Implementation
subsections: Risk assessment models: Probability of Failure (PoF) x Consequence of Failure (CoF)
Dynamic maintenance strategy formulation: Balancing cost and reliability
Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) digitization and AR assistance

sections.title: 7.2 Supply Chain and Spare Parts Optimization
subsections: Predictive inventory management based on failure rates
Emergency logistics and shared warehouse networks
Supplier quality management and lifecycle tracking

sections.title: 7.3 Workforce 2.0 and Safety Culture
subsections: Intelligent safety supervision: Computer vision for violation detection
Training transformation: VR/MR immersive simulation training
Performance evaluation metrics for the digital O&M era

chapters.title: Chapter 8: Strategic Roadmap, Investment Analysis, and Risk Control

sections.title: 8.1 Economic Analysis and ROI Models
subsections: Total Expenditure (TOTEX) modeling: CAPEX vs. OPEX trade-offs
Benefit analysis: Outage reduction, life extension, and efficiency gains
Investment priority ranking for intelligent upgrades

sections.title: 8.2 Cybersecurity and Systemic Risks
subsections: Supply chain security and localization of critical components
Defense-in-depth strategies for O&M control systems
Data privacy and cross-border data transfer regulations

sections.title: 8.3 Future Outlook and Implementation Roadmap (2025-2030)
subsections: Short-term (1-2 years): Foundation building and pilot projects
Mid-term (3-4 years): Scale-up and platform integration
Long-term (5+ years): Autonomous O&M and AI-native grid

style_guide:
# 《电力公司输变配电典型运维研究报告》风格指南

*   **语调规范**
    *   保持绝对客观与技术严谨性，剔除所有情绪化表达与营销辞令（如“卓越”、“颠覆”）。
    *   文风需干练、紧凑，优先使用陈述句，确保决策层能快速获取高密度信息。

*   **结构逻辑**
    *   遵循“数据现状 -> 归因分析 -> 解决方案”的逻辑闭环。
    *   **数据先行**：每章节必须以关键 KPI（如故障停运率、运维成本率）开篇。
    *   **结论清晰**：段落结尾需提供可执行的具体技术或管理建议，拒绝模棱两可。

*   **数据约束**
    *   数据必须真实可溯源，严格标注出处（如：电网年报、CIGRE、IEEE 标准），严禁模糊估算或虚构。
    *   全文严格限制为 **1 张关键参数对比表** 与 **1 张核心趋势图**，拒绝无效数据堆砌。

*   **语言准则**
    *   实施“零废话”原则，删除修饰性形容词，多用动词与名词。
    *   精准使用行业术语（如：状态检修 CBM、N-1 准则、馈线自动化），避免同一概念的重复阐述。

*   **图表要求**
    *   仅保留 **一张** 最具分析价值的核心图表（如：全生命周期成本分析图）。
    *   图注需精炼至 20 字以内，直接揭示数据背后的核心洞察，而非单纯描述现象。
global_thesis: 本报告立足“双碳”背景，深刻论证了输变配电运维从传统模式向“数据驱动智能化”转型的必然性。全书通过融合数字孪生等技术，构建了适应高比例新能源的智能运维策略，旨在为电力企业在2024-2030年间提升电网韧性、实现资产精益管理提供关键战略指引。
